data.title: Call signs
data.text:
History

Tactical call signs are used to identify squadrons over the radio or in messages without disclosing their actual identity to unauthorized listeners. Their use dates to World War 2, but Marine helicopter squadrons first used call sign in combat during the Korean War.

In Korea, call signs changed on a regular basis; during the Vietnam War, squadrons might use the same call sign for more than a year. Today, squadrons deploying to a combat zone,i.e. Iraq and Afghanistan, are assigned a "theater" call sign for use during that deployment only.
